programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Ziggy Marley meets Danny at Vamp'd to commission a restoration on his father, Bob Marley's, vintage Mercedes.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny must do a full bumper-to-bumper restoration on a '66 Mustang convertible, but after stripping it down, he finds very little car between her bumpers; Danny must to decide between asking for more money or losing a bunch of his own.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When Danny is asked to create a commemorative bike that honors music legend Les Paul he has to pull out all the stops.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Ryan and Kevin head to the Bonneville Salt Flats to see The Turbinator, a vehicle that holds a land speed record try to break 500 MPH.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: After months of bribery, bickering and buffoonery, Roli's tiny electric car is complete. Will Danny and the guys be as excited about the finished product as he is?

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin's brother is a judge, but that won't get him a free ride, and the guys struggle to finish his '62 Chevy pick-up within budget.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Representatives from Sailor Jerry enlist the shop's help to build a bike to commemorate the late artist's iconic style and to auction off at an upcoming charity fundraiser.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The local Fox News channel is looking to update their Ford Expedition Storm Chaser in the coolest way possible.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny impulsively buys a '69 Caddy and falls madly in love with her. Will he sell it for a big profit, or add her to his collection?

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny makes an old Ford Econoline look so cool that in the end, two buyers get into a bidding war for it. Danny can score big, but only if he can let his baby go.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has a last-minute change of heart and can't let go of a classic car he promised to sell to a loyal customer.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A family brings in an old pickup truck to be restored in memory of their mom, and Danny needs to figure out how to build the perfect tribute vehicle, without blowing the budget.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny Koker restores a 1969 Shelby GT500 numbers-matching car from a rust bucket into an instant classic. The team visits the Detroit Autorama.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the boys meet with a customer who wants a wicked paint job to match his wicked 1959 Anglia dragster.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has no interest in a rubber-to-roof restoration on a `73 Chevy Blazer until he hears that it's a tribute to the owner's nephew.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The huge photo shoot day for the Count's Kustoms calendar is approaching.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Legendary rocker George Lynch from the metal band Dokken stops by with his very cool 1965 Buick Riviera.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has a customer who wants to restore a 1942 Ford truck that saw some action in WWII. But when Danny takes in the project he quickly learns it'll need a lot more.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin and Roli make an unplanned stop to check out a mysteriously small vehicle. And later, Danny gets a call from Rob Zombie who wants to customize a truck for his upcoming tour.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny's battle with nightmare Z28 continues as he puts it though endless fabrication to bring it back to life. While it's being revived, Danny takes a break.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is so proud of the van he restored as a gift for his bandmate John Zito, that he decides to give his own classic van a make-over.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: This two-part episode starts with a client asking Danny to find and build a 1979 Camaro Z28, to commemorate the first car he ever owned.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: After two blown sales, Danny finally gets to customize a 1960 Chevy Delivery the way he wants to.

programme.desc: The shop has its hands full restoring a 1942 Ford truck that needed a lot of TLC and a special touch for the owner's wife. Danny and Ryan check out a badass 1929 Ford Roadster.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy drags Isaiah to Victorville as punishment for getting Cs on his report card; Kenny wants to furnish his new house, but there are eight reasons standing in his way; not to be cheesy, but Lisa learns a lot.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Lancaster turns into Ivy's honeypot, so everyone had better watch out or they might get stung; Lisa plans to use her brain when selecting lockers; Dusty and Tollbooth Lupe do a mitzvah.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Lisa comes to Montebello with a clear mind, intent on letting the lockers speak to her; Ivy lets his son navigate his way to a unit which turns out not to be completely vacant; Kenny is absolutely appalled by what he finds abandoned in his unit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The sun beats down in Oceanside, Calif., bringing out all the parasols; Dusty and Lupe steal a no-brainer locker, which pays off handsomely; Darrell taxes himself, and it almost puts him in storage jail; Brandi and Lisa find their true identities.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Tucked away in his storage Man Cave, Barry Weiss and Kenny sit down with Brandi and the Dotsons to relive old times, find out what they've been doing and gather intelligence, as he plans his return to the auction game.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Appraisals from collectors, experts and kooks help shape the buying process in this collection of clips.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny happens upon a familiar vehicle and follows it all the way to Lancaster for an auction; Rene tries to find new luck, after losing in Vegas; Lisa tries to make up for last time; the Calvins look to a higher power for their profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy kidnaps Pops and takes him to Rosamond, where they deftly score a fine locker; Kenny sets out to brighten everyone's day and his clowning around has him seeing stars; Lisa proves she has a friend... for now.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In West Covina, Brandi makes a serious land grab, and it pays off handsomely; Rene can't resist the mystery of a good safe; Kenny can't seem to satisfy his hunger; Barry takes an opportunity to poach from the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon revisit the scene of their greatest triumph; Jarrod and Brandi are introduced to a "Herbmeister"; Rene and Casey land a sweet score.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders head to Rancho Cucamonga, Calif.; Ivy opens his wallet for the right locker; buyers Darrell and Brandon stay hungry.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Lisa returns to Moreno Valley, where it all started, and gets nostalgic with her locker; Kenny welcomes a new granddaughter to the clan and would love to find an appropriate unit; Dusty and Lupe put a little elbow grease into their purchase.

programme.title: Storage Wars

programme.desc: After seeing footage Jep shot using a GoPro, Si decides he wants to use the camera to record a day in his life. But when Si gets on the guys nerves while they're hunting, they kick him and his GoPros out of the blind.

programme.desc: When the duck guys have to pull an all-nighter to finish some work, Willie decides he wants to join them. But when a dying smoke detector distracts them from their work.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1971 Suburban returns to the shop for "phase two," wanting more power and custom metalwork; when a client finds parts and pieces of a '68 C10, Bill and the crew set on a new course for a ground-up build.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill gets déjà vu on a 1985 Chevy C10 square body; a handmade chassis; after a close call, Ekstensive makes a 1923 T-Bucket street safe.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Rocker Ted Nugent brings in his beloved '74 Bronco; Bill and the guys make an all-terrain beast unlike any other; With his creative sparks flying, Bill gets going on a build he's dreamed about for years: a handmade, all-tube, off-road buggy.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A local client wants the teams help to surprise his dad with a custom 1946 Ford Coupe; Bill goes for a mix of both classy and supercharged when working on his wife's 2021 Escalade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive needs a new shop truck, Bill and the guys go sky-high with a lifted '21 F-450 King Ranch capable of hauling over 20,000 pounds; with most of the '46 Ford Coupe body beyond repair, the team has no choice but to build from the ground up.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys hit the home stretch on the '46 Ford Blue Thunder, its once-rusted shell now rebuilt into a one-of-one showstopper; Bill is surprised when John Cena drops off a '69 MGC.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian begins assembly of a custom LJ chassis and builds a full Jeep out of a pile of metal tubs before he adds front and rear axles with cut-to-length control arms, and finishes off the build with coil-over suspension.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The custom Jeep JL gets a drivetrain after Ian finds a junkyard LS engine to install, later he fabricates the exhaust.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The chassis on the Jeep JL are powder coated before Ian bolts everything in place and fabricates the body panels.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Larger tires on an off-road rig usually mean broken axles; a 1989 Dodge Ram Charger is in the shop; Ian shows how to swap out a semi-float axle for the more desirable full-float axle.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The crew works on wiring, plumbing, body panel installation and the interior on the buggy; Ian hits the trails in a custom Jeep LJ.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian doesn't want to fix a beat-up Polaris XP 900. He wants to turn it into a completely different rig. He decides to stretch the side by side and add longer suspension for more travel, but that's just the beginning.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian turns his focus to what the Polaris needs to stay safe on the trails.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: An '80s Ramcharger is back in the shop for an engine swap.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian moves weight around on a Samurai to help it handle the rocks better.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian and his friends visit off-road parks and enjoy some Tennessee whiskey.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian brings back the Suzuki Samurai for an old-fashioned engine swap.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian rebuilds the dash on the LJ Buggy and adds some off-road lights.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian demonstrates how to stretch a JK 10 inches.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The JK stretch project is ready for an all-new suspension and axles.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian outfits his Nissan Titan to tow his new Tracker side by side.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The RamCharger needs to be outfitted for overlanding.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian tears down a Dodge Dakota and turns it into a tools-carrying monster.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian works on the Shop Truck Dakota's transmission and axles.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian finds the perfect service bed and finishes up with a custom paint job.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian gets invited to ride in the 2020 Ultimate Adventure.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian starts work on an all-aluminum Defender that has a Jeep JK chassis.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian installs more of the Defender's drivetrain, plus wheels and tires.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian creates his own short bed Jeep Gladiator by transforming a Jeep JK.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian modifies a 1998 Chevy T6500 for towing, overlanding and motorhoming.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian makes tons of custom parts to finish the All-Aluminum Defender project.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian gets a cheap Mercedes 300D ready for a local Gambler 500 rally.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since the Bronco is back, Ian pays homage to the very cool box-style Bronco of the past. He helps with the handling by adding an upgraded suspension, and adds new bumpers for a more aggressive look. Plus, he fixes some gremlins in the inline-six mot.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: How a factory two-door Toyota Tacoma can be made into the perfect off-road truck with the right axles and suspension.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian continues the Tacoma project, but this time he completely reshapes the truck with a fiberglass body kit and truck cap, then cuts out the rear window to give it a vintage 4Runner look.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian takes the All-Aluminum Defender on the Kentucky Adventure Trail.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian turns a stack of tubes into a shorter trail chassis and adds new axles.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The mock-up on the trail chassis continues as Ian adds a motor and transmission to the build; it's time to get axles underneath with a new third member so he can go four-wheel drive all the time.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian brings in a 1968 M715 to make it more reliable; he takes the body off the original chassis and stretches a Jeep JK chassis to make it fit; he adds upgraded suspension, 1-ton axles and an LS engine to make it a truck that can fight any battle.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since a TJ can be had for under 10K, Ian shows how to buy a Jeep on a budget and outfit it with everything needed to hit the rocks and still have money left over.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The Budget TJ gets some more parts; Ian updates the suspension with new coilovers; he adds new bumpers front and rear, and by the end of the day, this TJ is trail ready.

programme.title: FourWheeler

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1971 Suburban returns to the shop for "phase two," wanting more power and custom metalwork; when a client finds parts and pieces of a '68 C10, Bill and the crew set on a new course for a ground-up build.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill gets déjà vu on a 1985 Chevy C10 square body; a handmade chassis; after a close call, Ekstensive makes a 1923 T-Bucket street safe.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Rocker Ted Nugent brings in his beloved '74 Bronco; Bill and the guys make an all-terrain beast unlike any other; With his creative sparks flying, Bill gets going on a build he's dreamed about for years: a handmade, all-tube, off-road buggy.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A local client wants the teams help to surprise his dad with a custom 1946 Ford Coupe; Bill goes for a mix of both classy and supercharged when working on his wife's 2021 Escalade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive needs a new shop truck, Bill and the guys go sky-high with a lifted '21 F-450 King Ranch capable of hauling over 20,000 pounds; with most of the '46 Ford Coupe body beyond repair, the team has no choice but to build from the ground up.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys hit the home stretch on the '46 Ford Blue Thunder, its once-rusted shell now rebuilt into a one-of-one showstopper; Bill is surprised when John Cena drops off a '69 MGC.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian begins assembly of a custom LJ chassis and builds a full Jeep out of a pile of metal tubs before he adds front and rear axles with cut-to-length control arms, and finishes off the build with coil-over suspension.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The custom Jeep JL gets a drivetrain after Ian finds a junkyard LS engine to install, later he fabricates the exhaust.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The chassis on the Jeep JL are powder coated before Ian bolts everything in place and fabricates the body panels.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Larger tires on an off-road rig usually mean broken axles; a 1989 Dodge Ram Charger is in the shop; Ian shows how to swap out a semi-float axle for the more desirable full-float axle.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The crew works on wiring, plumbing, body panel installation and the interior on the buggy; Ian hits the trails in a custom Jeep LJ.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian doesn't want to fix a beat-up Polaris XP 900. He wants to turn it into a completely different rig. He decides to stretch the side by side and add longer suspension for more travel, but that's just the beginning.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian turns his focus to what the Polaris needs to stay safe on the trails.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: An '80s Ramcharger is back in the shop for an engine swap.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian moves weight around on a Samurai to help it handle the rocks better.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian and his friends visit off-road parks and enjoy some Tennessee whiskey.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian brings back the Suzuki Samurai for an old-fashioned engine swap.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian rebuilds the dash on the LJ Buggy and adds some off-road lights.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian demonstrates how to stretch a JK 10 inches.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The JK stretch project is ready for an all-new suspension and axles.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian outfits his Nissan Titan to tow his new Tracker side by side.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The RamCharger needs to be outfitted for overlanding.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian tears down a Dodge Dakota and turns it into a tools-carrying monster.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian works on the Shop Truck Dakota's transmission and axles.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian finds the perfect service bed and finishes up with a custom paint job.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian gets invited to ride in the 2020 Ultimate Adventure.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian starts work on an all-aluminum Defender that has a Jeep JK chassis.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian installs more of the Defender's drivetrain, plus wheels and tires.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian creates his own short bed Jeep Gladiator by transforming a Jeep JK.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian modifies a 1998 Chevy T6500 for towing, overlanding and motorhoming.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian makes tons of custom parts to finish the All-Aluminum Defender project.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian gets a cheap Mercedes 300D ready for a local Gambler 500 rally.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since the Bronco is back, Ian pays homage to the very cool box-style Bronco of the past. He helps with the handling by adding an upgraded suspension, and adds new bumpers for a more aggressive look. Plus, he fixes some gremlins in the inline-six mot.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: How a factory two-door Toyota Tacoma can be made into the perfect off-road truck with the right axles and suspension.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian continues the Tacoma project, but this time he completely reshapes the truck with a fiberglass body kit and truck cap, then cuts out the rear window to give it a vintage 4Runner look.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian takes the All-Aluminum Defender on the Kentucky Adventure Trail.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian turns a stack of tubes into a shorter trail chassis and adds new axles.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The mock-up on the trail chassis continues as Ian adds a motor and transmission to the build; it's time to get axles underneath with a new third member so he can go four-wheel drive all the time.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian brings in a 1968 M715 to make it more reliable; he takes the body off the original chassis and stretches a Jeep JK chassis to make it fit; he adds upgraded suspension, 1-ton axles and an LS engine to make it a truck that can fight any battle.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since a TJ can be had for under 10K, Ian shows how to buy a Jeep on a budget and outfit it with everything needed to hit the rocks and still have money left over.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The Budget TJ gets some more parts; Ian updates the suspension with new coilovers; he adds new bumpers front and rear, and by the end of the day, this TJ is trail ready.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since a TJ can be had for under 10K, Ian shows how to buy a Jeep on a budget and outfit it with everything needed to hit the rocks and still have money left over.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Being hunted by the Dog is a lousy way to celebrate your birthday but that's exactly the spot that Robert finds himself in today. He's missed his court date, quit his job, and vacated his last known address.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: For a guy who started life as a free spirited outlaw-biker Dog has certainly turned into a family man. His children touch everything he does today, from searching for the perfect gift for his daughter Cecily's birthday to hunting a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't have the whole team today and he's got to catch a fugitive with a record of criminal assault. But when Dog finds the fugitive's former girlfriend, she thinks he isn't dangerous at all.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Before Tim heads out for a tough day of bounty hunting, he likes to get in a little quality time with his daughter, Summer Rain. This morning, he takes the toddler for a spin around the yard in her little red wagon.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There's no rest for the righteous and nobody knows this better then the Dog. He is committed to saving his new friend's bail bonding business, and now must race against time to bring a rogues gallery to justice.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A small town bondsmen is in over his head, his business on the line, when he makes a desperate plea for help. Dog agrees and launches a high stake hunt through the desolate and dangerous mountain landscape of western Colorado.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Once in Montrose, Dog discovers that the million dollar fugitive is not the young bondsman's only problem. His kind heart and inexperience have led him to bail out a bevy of bail jumpers.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Can Dog complete his mission to clean-up this frontier town? With four outlaws still on the lam, Dog sets out to bring 'em in. As day turns into night and with the darkness and the danger mounting, an undaunted Dog and team plan late night hits.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: After releasing the second part of his autobiography, Dog and his family traveled across America, and this very special episode offers an intimate portrait of both the public and private moments of that journey.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's case involves a Samoan so Dog knows that the runner's close-knit kinfolk hold the keys to bringing him in.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the Historic Calumet Inn, in Pipestone, Minnesota. Joint owners, Vanda and Rina Smrkovski were given the inn as a gift by their father (who they still call “daddy”), and they treat it with less respect than a dolls house.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is D-Place in Chelmsford, Essex run by Mexican-born Israel and his English partner Tara. They've sunk ~£150,000 of their own money into their trendy café bar which offers a vast selection of fusion cuisine. In charge is Executive Chef Philippe, producing everything from all-day breakfasts to hoi sin noodles with an astounding lack of flair; the plastic food is dire and boomerangs back from the dining room as soon as it's cooked.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay helps a soul food restaurant owner who can't seem to let her head chef do any of the cooking.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's fourth programme is La Riviera, a fine dining restaurant in Inverness. Owned by multi-millionaire Barry Larson and costing ~£8000 a week to run, the place boasts top French chef Loic Lefebvre and an impeccably-trained kitchen staff with Michelin star-studded backgrounds. Loic is on a mission, to bring sophisticated French cooking to the home of haggis, tatties and deep-fried Mars bars. But though he's hungry for success, he's French, he's arrogant and the food's pretentious.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Daleks pursue the TARDIS through time and space.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: With the Daleks in pursuit, the TARDIS lands in what appears to be a haunted house.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor and his friends are taken prisoner by the Mechonoids.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor informs the Kaled government of Davros's experiments and they move to shut down the bunker.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: When the Kaled dome is destroyed, the war appears to be over and the Thals rejoice at their victory.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Kaled elite move to prevent the development of the Daleks while the Doctor hopes to destroy them forever.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: Hiding on board the Dalek spaceship, Ian is taken to the mines of Bedfordshire.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor, Susan and David discover a nearby firebomb, left by Robomen to destroy London.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: Ian and his friend Larry are chased by the Slyther, protecting the Bedfordshire mines.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: On Draconia, the Doctor reveals the Master's plan to provoke war.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: Arriving on Earth, the Doctor, Harry and Sarah meet a group of stranded human colonists.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: Sarah has been captured by Styre who is conducting experiments on the captured humans.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: Davros is held captive aboard a prison in space.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: The battle at the prison station continues.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: Davros has awoken from his centuries long slumber and is taken prisoner by the Doctor.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor discovers that the Daleks need Davros to break the stalemate in their war with the Movellans.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: Silent but deadly androids are protecting a bomb buried beneath the Earth.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.desc: The Doctor sees TARDIS arrive on Thoros-Beta.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Vervoids begin to attack the crew and passengers.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor realizes something about the Vervoids life span.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who

programme.title: After the First 48
programme.desc: A woman is badly beaten, set on fire, and left to die in a trailer on the outskirts of Houston. Investigators discover that the assault was likely a revenge attack.

programme.title: After the First 48
programme.desc: In Birmingham, AL, a woman, her son and her young niece are stabbed more than 75 times then set on fire inside their apartment. Investigators zero in on the victims' relative.

programme.title: After the First 48
programme.desc: A robbery at a Cleveland convenience store turns deadly when a store clerk is shot and killed. As police track down the men responsible, they discover more robberies.

programme.title: After the First 48
programme.desc: After a man is killed and several others are injured, the Tulsa Police Department and District Attorney's Office team up with the homeless community to convict a potential spree killer.

programme.title: After the First 48
programme.desc: In Mobile, Ala., a professor is murdered in his own home; it takes a missing gaming console, and a strategic game of cat and mouse with the suspects, for detectives and prosecutors to get justice.

programme.title: After the First 48
programme.desc: When a transient man is gunned downed, the only eyewitness Mobile detectives have is also a suspect; reluctant witnesses, defendants pointing fingers at each other, and a surprise ruling leaves a novice prosecutor struggling to clinch his case.

programme.title: After the First 48
programme.desc: When three people are gunned down in a Tulsa home, detectives face two suspects, and a web of lies; prosecutors are left with circumstantial evidence to clinch the case against a calculated, cold-blooded killer.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: After a series of dark and ominous events, an unassuming family home on Long Island becomes the most notorious house in America; 50 years later, it's spawned a title wave of books, documentaries, and films.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: An infamous Cold War cold case involving nine hikers found mutilated on a remote mountain slope; for over 60 years, authorities and amateurs alike have been trying to figure out what happened in a place that's been called "Russia's Area 51."

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: As the Cold War ramps up, a well-dressed man is found dead within miles of a nuclear testing site on a tranquil Australian beach; there are no clues to his identity or what could have happened.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: It's one of the most famous stories from the Bible; for thousands of years the tale of Noah's Ark is shared, but little is known about what happened to the ark.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: During World War Two, the Nazis stole vast amounts of art, gold, silver and currency, and stashed it across Europe; while some of the plunder has been recovered, much more is still missing nearly 80 years later.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: It's the only unsolved air piracy case in history; in 1971, a man hijacks a Northwest Orient Airlines flight, demanding four parachutes and $200,000; he jumps out of the plane with the money and is never seen again.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A series of unexplained deaths near Chicago in 1982 starts a nationwide panic; the victims are connected by one frightening detail: cyanide-tainted capsules of Extra-Strength Tylenol; 40 years later, it remains an active FBI investigation.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The White House has consistently denied having any knowledge of alien craft visiting Earth, but presidential encounters with UFOs and other strange phenomena can be found going all the way back to George Washington.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Examining the unique geology and location of Mount Shasta in northern California, to determine why it is known as a hotbed of strange events, from Big Foot sightings to UFO encounters to hikers vanishing without a trace.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Counting down the world's top 10 alien encounters, from the first reported abduction event to mass UFO sightings over New York's Hudson Valley to an incident in ancient Rome.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists investigate the mystery of the human genome and ponder the possibility that extraterrestrials aided in the survival of mankind from its earliest days.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Millions of people around the world have reported encountering shadowy entities who instill fear, shortness of breath, and even paralysis; they could be figments of the imagination or visitors from other worlds or dimensions.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Throughout the ancient world, tales are told of fire-breathing dragons; though fearsome, they have been worshipped as the bringers of great knowledge and credited as the founders of civilization.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Today, more people than ever believe that unidentified flying objects are of alien origin; exploring the possibility that they are capable of bending both time and space.

programme.title: Waco: Madman or Messiah
programme.desc: The raid of Mount Carmel develops into a 51-day stand-off between the Branch Davidians and the FBI. A direct line of communication is established between FBI negotiators and David Koresh on the inside.

programme.title: Cults and Extreme Belief
programme.desc: As a recruiter for multi-level marketing self-help group NXIVM, Sarah Edmondson brought thousands of people to the organization. In October of 2017, she exposed the group as a destructive sex-cult.

programme.title: Cults and Extreme Belief
programme.desc: Former Jehovah's Witness Romy Maple--a survivor of child sexual abuse--embarks on a journey to uncover why her pleas for justice were systematically ignored by top members of the organization.

programme.title: Cults and Extreme Belief
programme.desc: Amy Bril recounts her childhood growing up in the Children of God, a group notorious for pedophilia and "religious" prostitution.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: A master manipulator is accused of the murder of his wife, and is eventually caught out by a polygraph test - and his own fiancée.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon in upscale Lodi, California, a 12-year-old girl is abducted from her home. Scores of police officers and FBI agents converge, determined to find the young girl before it is too late. When the kidnapper's car is discovered in a field near Lodi, police dogs, helicopters, and hundreds of volunteers are employed in a round-the-clock search. It would take a community united in concern for one of their youngest to find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 26, 1993, an explosion rocked the World Trade Center parking garage. Six people died and more than a thousand were injured in the bomb blast that tore a 5-story crater in the building. During the investigation, the twisted fender of a rental van was extracted from the rubble. The FBI was able to determine from where the van was rented and by whom. Undercover agents then made their arrests within six days of the bombing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On June 21, 1964, three civil rights workers, two white and one black disappeared in Mississippi while passing through Neshoba County. A massive FBI investigation led to the recovery of the bodies of the slain men and physical evidence was recovered and analyzed. The FBI labs confirmed that all but one of the bullets used to kill the men came from the same gun. The FBI gained the trust of an informant, whose information led to the conviction of seven local Ku Klux Klan members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In November of 1994, when a Wells Fargo armored van disappeared from a Glendale, Arizona mall, local authorities and the FBI scrambled to recover it, and its cargo of nearly a million dollars. Six hours later, agents found the van, its driver shot dead inside and the money gone. It was a perfect hit by professionals who left no clue behind. Months passed before a solid lead developed. In January, a tip led agents to look into a former prison guard.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1984, south Miami became the home for a sadistic serial killer. Posing as a fashion photographer, Christopher Wilder lured young women from shopping malls with promises of fame and fortune. Most ended up dead. As the FBI closed in around him, Wilder took off on a cross-country murderous rampage. The FBI added Wilder to their Most Wanted Fugitives program. The chase was on, and Wilder ultimately lost.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in summer of 1990, the bodies of several women began turning up in and around the city of Vienna, Austria. From an extensive investigation by the Viennese police, it was determined that these murders were the work of one sadistic predator. Europe was dealing with a serial killer. With no experience with this kind of predator, Viennese police turned to the FBI. FBI profilers were able to identify a suspect in the murders. More ominously, they linked this same killer to murders committed in the United States.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By April of 1995 in Washington, D.C., two officers had been shot and one had been murdered. Each had been sitting in their patrol cars when a man sneaked up and opened fire. The FBI was brought in to help catch the cop killer. Agents identified the man who was most likely the killer, but he was nowhere to be found. Months of surveillance operations around the country finally yielded a break; they found their suspect in Baltimore, MD.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Kokomo, Indiana an unthinkable crime terrified residents. A young woman was snatched from her home on a bright spring morning. Drops of blood and a torn window screen were all that was left to tell authorities what happened to the twenty-one year old victim. After several days of searching, a former FBI profiler narrowed the suspect list to one. Agents and detectives followed the trail across state lines hoping to find the victim before her time ran out.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1990's drug gangs terrorized Harlem, New York neighborhoods. When a 10-year-old boy fell victim in the crossfire, NYPD detectives and FBI agents clamped down on the problem. They formed a task force called C-11, designed to dismantle the gangs. In an environment of violence and fear it would be difficult to identify, arrest and convict those involved in the secretive and deadly world of big money drugs.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In rural Texas, 13-year-old is kidnapped on her way to school. Frantic to find her safely, her millionaire father calls local authorities and the FBI. As police officers and agents conduct aerial surveillance, the father drives hundreds of miles through the night to deliver the ransom cash to a drop that the kidnappers keep changing. In a final effort to save the young girl, investigators must engage in a dangerous firefight with five desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: He was a recluse who spread terror through the mail for 18 years. Two men died and more than a dozen were injured, but Ted Kaczynski wasn't known as the Unabomber until his brother tipped off the FBI. Kaczynski's “Unabomber Manifesto,” published in major newspapers, set off a flurry of activity for the FBI: writing analysis and comparisons, DNA gleaned from a single postage stamp and finally, Kaczynski's arrest at his tiny cabin.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, a series of crimes in a small Iowa farming community left residents reeling in shock and fear. Two young men went on a crime spree of robbery, kidnapping and murder, and then disappeared. By the time they were identified, they already had a twelve-hour lead. As the hunt for the two men expanded, the FBI committed its resources to tracking down the suspects. The pursuit would take agents across six states to catch the killers before they struck again.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El primero de octubre de 1993, un extraño secuestró a Polly Klaas de doce años durante una piyamada en su casa. El FBI de inmediato entró en el caso. Los agentes reunieron fibras de su habitación y descubrieron, a través del uso de fuentes de luz láser, la huella de una palma en la cama de Polly, previamente invisible al ojo humano. Después de una extensa investigación de dos meses, el FBI arrestó a Richard Allen Davis. La impresión de la palma y las fibras coincidieron y Davis fue condenado por secuestro y asesinato.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Two couples found themselves on the same deserted island paradise. But only one couple left alive. Buck Walker and Stephanie Stearns arrived in Hawaii on the Sea Wind, which belonged to the missing couple, Mac and Muff Graham. Buck and Stephanie were arrested and served time for boat theft. But years later, bones were discovered on the deserted island and identified as the remains of Muff Graham.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Residents of the small town of Noel, Missouri were shocked when one of their banks was robbed. When the bank president was nowhere to be found, the residents were outraged. The FBI discovered that things are not always as they appear. Minute clues led the agents to the body of the bank president. With no suspects, the FBI relied on dogged determination and modern forensics. Agents slowly pieced together tiny shreds of evidence.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Anchorage, Alaska, a young mother and her two daughters were sexually assaulted and brutally murdered. There was only one piece of forensic evidence: a washrag carrying pubic lice that the killer used to clean himself after the crime. Employing an unusual and original method, an FBI expert combed through all the hairs and fibers in the apartment. He was not only able to determine how long each hair had been there, but which hairs came from the killer and how the crime proceeded.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Corruption in the New Orleans Police Department grew like a cancer in the early 1990's. Lured by the easy wealth of the narcotics industry, crooked cops began breaking the laws they were sworn to uphold. They would stop at nothing, including murder, to protect their rackets. When it became clear they could no longer police themselves, the FBI got involved. Putting their lives on the line, undercover agents devised a way to flush out the violent cops and restore trust in the city's police force.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Alabama, a pair of convicted felons escaped the custody of a local deputy and fled across the country. Eluding authorities, they moved from state to state in a wave of abduction and car theft. When a foreign military officer disappeared along their trail, police and FBI agents wondered if the armed fugitives had become killers. Agents believed the pair were growing more violent and raced to find the escapees before more victims crossed their path.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: After a series of brutal bank robberies and murders in south Miami during the mid-1980's, the FBI embarked on an exhaustive eight-month investigation. With little evidence and no suspects, agents were willing to try anything to find the violent perpetrators. On April 11, 1986, agents conducting routine surveillance spotted the vehicle used in the bank robberies. They attempted to arrest the two suspects in the car. What followed was the bloodiest firefight in FBI history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A stranger snatched an eight-year-old girl as she played in her Tucson, Arizona neighborhood, leaving behind an abandoned bicycle and a frantic mother. Hundreds of citizens and police officers fanned out across the region, hoping to find some trace of the young girl or her abductor. Within hours, a suspect emerged; a drifter who was out on parole for abducting and molesting children. He was nowhere to be found and time had run out for the innocent child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1990's drug gangs terrorized Harlem, New York neighborhoods. When a 10-year-old boy fell victim in the crossfire, NYPD detectives and FBI agents clamped down on the problem. They formed a task force called C-11, designed to dismantle the gangs. In an environment of violence and fear it would be difficult to identify, arrest and convict those involved in the secretive and deadly world of big money drugs.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At first it seemed like a tragic hunting accident when 18-year-old David Wilkey was shot to death in rural Virginia in 1983. A tenacious insurance investigator suspected foul play, but he had no direct evidence. Two years later a man contacted North Carolina FBI agents with a complex story of conspiracy and murder-for-hire: he claimed he had been hired to murder Wilkey's killer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a successful television producer was gunned down in his New York office. It looked like a professional hit. With no leads, the investigation stalled. Four years later and a continent away, a man told Los Angeles police he had been hired to murder two exotic dancers. Investigators linked the two crimes and uncovered a businessman willing to kill to protect his interests.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Claude Dallas lived the life of a cowboy. A loner and distrustful of authority, he lived off the land, poaching wildlife and selling the hides. But when two game wardens confronted Dallas about his deeds, they were shot and killed. After a massive manhunt, Dallas was captured and convicted, only to escape months later. Making the FBI's Ten Most Wanted list, Dallas eluded the law for almost a year until the FBI tracked him down in a small town in California.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Larry Horn nearly got away with the perfect crime: a multiple murder-for-hire plot that was meticulously planned and executed. Horn's former wife, their 8-year-old son, and a live-in nurse were all brutally murdered by an assassin. In the absence of any significant clues, police in Maryland contacted the FBI to assist in the investigation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On June 21, 1964, three civil rights workers, two white and one black disappeared in Mississippi while passing through Neshoba County. A massive FBI investigation led to the recovery of the bodies of the slain men and physical evidence was recovered and analyzed. The FBI labs confirmed that all but one of the bullets used to kill the men came from the same gun. The FBI gained the trust of an informant, whose information led to the conviction of seven local Ku Klux Klan members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Local law enforcement became stumped when the body of an unidentified young woman turned up on a highway in their small Pennsylvania town. They turned to the FBI labs. The hi-tech lab enabled investigators and agents to identify the victim. Knowing who she was allowed agents to reconstruct her every move. Though the road to finding her killer was twisted and long, agents persisted.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Two couples found themselves on the same deserted island paradise. But only one couple left alive. Buck Walker and Stephanie Stearns arrived in Hawaii on the Sea Wind, which belonged to the missing couple, Mac and Muff Graham. Buck and Stephanie were arrested and served time for boat theft. But years later, bones were discovered on the deserted island and identified as the remains of Muff Graham.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In rural Texas, 13-year-old is kidnapped on her way to school. Frantic to find her safely, her millionaire father calls local authorities and the FBI. As police officers and agents conduct aerial surveillance, the father drives hundreds of miles through the night to deliver the ransom cash to a drop that the kidnappers keep changing. In a final effort to save the young girl, investigators must engage in a dangerous firefight with five desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Langley, Virginia, a gunman fired into rush hour traffic. The brazen daytime shooting of employees from the Central Intelligence Agency stunned the country. The victims seemed randomly selected, but the motive appeared to be political. The FBI was called in, but the nationwide search quickly became a far-reaching international manhunt. Agents processed more than 2000 leads and crossed an ocean in the effort to deliver justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A young mother and her infant son mysteriously disappeared from their home. The woman's husband was the only suspect, but he was eventually cleared. There was no solid evidence that a crime had even been committed. Six months later, a local farmer found the remains of the missing woman and her child. Both had been murdered. Agents and local police had only one tiny piece of evidence, an unidentified hair found in the murdered woman's car. The hair was too small for analysis.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When five-year-old Melissa Brannen disappeared from a Christmas party in December 1989, the only probable suspect was 24-year-old Caleb Hughes. Hughes reportedly left the party around the time Melissa vanished, but no one saw him with the girl. Fifty blue acrylic fibers collected during a search of Hughes' car, however, became the major piece of evidence in the case. FBI fiber analysis determined that those fibers were identical to the ones that made up the sweater Melissa was wearing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer night in 1990, a body was discovered burning in a Minnesota alley. Weeks later, police finally identified the victim, a suspected drug courier from California. The FBI began working with local police and slowly uncovered a multi-state crime ring run by a deadly drug lord who used violence and intimidation to keep those around him silent. Agents needed to infiltrate and dismantle the crew before more people died.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When police in a small Washington State community began looking into the disappearance of a 22-year-old woman, they had no way of knowing it would evolve into a nationwide hunt for a sexual sadist. Police knew the killer's identity, but he was a master of disguise. The FBI was called on to help. Agents discovered that several unsuspecting women across the northwest had fallen prey to his charms.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At first it seemed like a tragic hunting accident when 18-year-old David Wilkey was shot to death in rural Virginia in 1983. A tenacious insurance investigator suspected foul play, but he had no direct evidence. Two years later a man contacted North Carolina FBI agents with a complex story of conspiracy and murder-for-hire: he claimed he had been hired to murder Wilkey's killer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, the FBI began a massive undercover operation, code named Safebet, that was designed to expose the Chicago Mafia's infiltration into the city's surrounding suburbs. Undercover agents quickly discovered that the mob had its tentacles spread into every facet of the law enforcement community. They unwittingly uncovered the murder of a wealthy socialite perpetrated by a jealous and greedy mob lawyer and covered up by the local police chief.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After shooting his victims in the head, the killer staged the scene, placed the incriminating evidence into a plastic bag and tossed it into the river.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A lifelong resident of the tiny town of Lefroy, Tasmania was murdered outside his own home. Robbery appeared to be the motive, but with no suspects, the investigation came to a halt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman went missing, friends and family were determined to find her. Their worst fears were confirmed weeks later when her body was discovered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000, Christina Sanoubane was murdered in her Cedar Rapids apartment after moving away from her abusive boyfriend. There are clues at the scene: bloody footprints and DNA from the victim's rape kit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1969, 25-year-old phone operator¾Diane Maxwell is raped and murdered. Her brother promised he'd find out who was responsible and bring the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2004, nursing student Tamika Huston went missing from her Spartanburg, South Carolina home. A tip led detectives to her car and they find an unknown house key that could help solve the case.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It's usually easy to determine how a criminal entered the crime scene. But in this case, it was far from clear. It looked like the killer vanished into thin air...and perhaps he had.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The crime scene was especially violent: A husband and wife had been shot to death in their bedroom. Was their 16-year-daughter complicit?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The woman could have lost control of her SUV on the icy road, and plunged down an embankment into a shallow creek. But there were footprints in the snow leading away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim had ingested a massive amount of cyanide. An unlikely clue _ a flaw on a mailing envelope _ exposed a murderer who was willing to kill innocent people.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim was well liked and successful, which made the brutality of the crime even harder to understand.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: One warm summer afternoon, the town of Verona, Wisconsin faced its first triple homicide. To solve the case, investigators had to delve into the world of high rollers and offshore betting.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college senior was found raped and murdered near an unpaved footpath used by students to walk from one side of campus to the other.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, young mother Tammy Tatum was found sexually assaulted and murdered in her Longmont, Colorado apartment. Police initially suspected her estranged husband, but did not have enough evidence to charge him and the case went cold.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000, the body of exotic dancer Rachel Siani was found beneath a New Jersey bridge. Investigators wondered if she had committed suicide. They discovered that Rachel offered to assist a drunk customer named John 'Jack' Denofa to his motel room.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The medical examiner ruled the death an accident, but the detectives investigating the case thought the evidence at the scene indicated otherwise.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Rachael Mullenix, 19, was convicted of stabbing her mother, Barbara Mullenix, on Sept. 13, 2006, and then packing her bloodied corpse in a cardboard box before dumping it in Newport Bay on the California coast.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young girl was found dead, police quickly arrested the most likely suspect. But cutting-edge technology from NASA enabled a forensic odonatologist to prove the wrong man was behind bars.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2003, Tiffany Rowell and three of her friends were brutally murdered in their affluent Clear Lake, Texas.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This series profiles intriguing crimes where science catches the bad guy. Follow coroners, medical examiners, physicians, law enforcement officials, journalists and legal experts as they put together the pieces of the crime puzzle.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2001, Ginger Hayes and her infant son Nicholas were abducted during a carjacking and the crime had been reported by a witness within minutes of occurrence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a young girl was discovered on isolated farmland near Delano, California. She had no ID, but police found mailbox keys in the pocket of her jeans. With no other clues, they checked the mailboxes of every apartment building in Delano.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Doctors don't know why the young scientist is gravely ill. When tests finally reveal the cause, it's too late to save him. Police hope that lab analysis of his hair, showing when attempts were made on his life and what was used will lead to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000,¾Kristine Fitzhugh¾failed to show up for her music class and her husband Ken found her dead at the bottom of the stairs of their Palo Alto home. Upon further investigation, luminol reveals evidence of murder in the kitchen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2004, Mary Ann Clibbery was found brutally murdered in her Illinois business and investigators had to determine if this was a robbery gone wrong or a calculated murder.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a nine-year-old girl goes missing, police and volunteers spend weeks searching for her. A psychic's vision leads to a field where her body is discovered, along with what investigators hope is enough evidence to help them to also find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman who was known to have suffered from depression apparently took her own life. But her sister told police that, a year before her death, she said if anything were to happen to her, there was a note in the china cabinet.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a wealthy socialite died after falling down the stairs, witnesses said one thing and evidence indicated another. To find out what really happened, investigators turned to forensic science, a physicist and an expert in accident reconstruction.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Digital enhancement of security camera video shows that what appears to be a casual encounter is actually a forced abduction, leading to murder. When investigators suspect the crimes are not random, they fear a serial killer may be on the loose.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim had been sexually assaulted and stabbed to death on the beach. A pair of men's tennis shoes was discovered near her body. Police were sure that if they found the man who fit the shoes, they would also find the man who committed the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The killer probably hoped to cover his tracks by staging the crime scene. But investigators saw through the attempt almost immediately, and turned to forensic science to learn what really happened that night.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was one of the most brazen crimes of the 20th century.¾Adolph Coors III, chairman of the Coors Brewing Company, was kidnapped and held for ransom prompting one of the most intense manhunts in United States history.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When¾two women went missing and were later found brutally murdered, police wondered if they were victims of a hate crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1994, Paul Gruber's daughter suspected something was wrong when she received birthday cards addressed from Gruber, on which the handwriting wasn't Gruber's.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman was found dead on the bedroom floor of her apartment. The crime scene yielded little of value, and investigators wondered if they would find enough evidence to make a case, much less catch a killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A twelve-year-old girl claimed she had been abducted and sexually assaulted. She recounted what happened in such a flat, unemotional voice that police found it difficult to believe her. Fibers on her clothing would prove she was telling the truth.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young, attractive hairdresser was sexually assaulted and murdered in her own beauty salon. The evidence at the crime scene didn't match any of the suspects and, after the initial investigation, the case went cold for ten years.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1989, the dead bodies of Joan Rogers and her two teenage daughters were found floating in Tampa Bay.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a college student is reported missing, police believe their investigation will be like countless others. But when they discover blood spatter in her boyfriend's bedroom, they know this case is going to be different.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1995, Palm Beach waitress Denise O'Neill is abducted and murdered. Her neighbor Luis Caballero arouses suspicions by his odd behavior toward TV crews covering the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2007, the Florida mobile home of Effie and Michael Ratley catches fire and Michael heroically rescues his wife and infant son. A month later, his wife is found beaten to death in a bedroom of his parents' home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim was a self-made man who never minced words. Perhaps he was murdered by a disgruntled client or employee. Perhaps the racy photos in his safe held the clue to solving the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The bomb was constructed to cause as much damage as possible... and it did, killing the victim with deadly force and flame. A painstaking search yielded tiny clues, which identified the killer as surely as if he'd signed them.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Security cameras in a casino tracked a young woman's movements until shortly before she disappeared. She was never seen again, but through the evidence she left behind, she was able to tell investigators what happened to her and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The driver said he couldn't have hit and killed a pedestrian on a Harrisburg street. The Jeep Grand Cherokee he was leasing around that time had been sold months ago to a buyer in another state.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, when Derrick Duehren returned to his Oregon home, it had burned to the ground and his wife Roxanne's charred remains were found in the rubble. Investigators set out to determine if it was an unfortunate accident or arson and murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of an attractive young woman was found a mile from her abandoned car. Police were especially concerned when they realized the victim had come to them for protection just two weeks earlier, after a road rage incident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This series profiles intriguing crimes where science catches the bad guy. Follow coroners, medical examiners, physicians, law enforcement officials, journalists and legal experts as they put together the pieces of the crime puzzle.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into a brutal attack on two boys near a pond relies on evidence fished out of the murky water. It was the first case where Diatom evidence was used to place a suspect at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In an affluent suburb of Philadelphia, police were called to the scene of what appeared to be an accidental drowning. The investigation gradually focused on one person, a suspect who had more than a million reasons to want the victim dead.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1999, a 12-year-old was found murdered in her home and it changed the feeling of security residents had in the small town of Waseca, Minnesota. Despite a meticulous search of the home and an exhaustive investigation, police had no suspects.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Authorities track a kidnapper who allowed his victim, 17-year-old Shari Smith, to write a last will and testament on a note pad, then informed the family of her murder, as well as the later murder of a 10-year-old Debra May Helmick. A phone number written on a previous page left a lasting impression, which helped to convict Larry Gene Bell.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman went missing, friends and family were determined to find her. Their worst fears were confirmed weeks later when her body was discovered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman who was known to have suffered from depression apparently took her own life. But her sister told police that, a year before her death, she said if anything were to happen to her, there was a note in the china cabinet.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A fan of murder mysteries and forensic science shows uses what she learned from TV to determine who was responsible for the accident which permanently injured her 4-year-old daughter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, 16-month-old Anne Grace Gimmenstad became very ill, was rushed to the hospital and died within two weeks. Following extensive medical examinations, it was determined that Anna had been the victim of the deadly bacteria E.coli.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of 9-year-old Jessica Knott is investigated. Investigators use a garbage bag to connect suspect James Edward Crow, Jr. to the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1995, Debora Green lost two children in a fire that burnt down her Prairie Village, Kansas mansion. Routine procedures occurred and both Debora and her previous husband Michael Farrar were questioned. Suspicions arose when Debora refused to cooperate during questioning. Police then questioned Michael and uncovered disturbing stories proving Debora was dangerous.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This series profiles intriguing crimes where science catches the bad guy. Follow coroners, medical examiners, physicians, law enforcement officials, journalists and legal experts as they put together the pieces of the crime puzzle.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the decomposed body of a teenage girl is discovered in Pennsylvania, police have no clues to her identity. But weeks earlier, stabbing victim Kathy Sagusti told investigators she thought she might have heard a murder taking place in her basement.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two young children was found dead in her bedroom. Her death was ruled a suicide _ but when investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier, they decided to take another look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1983, two young boys were found tied and murdered with similar wounds within three months of each other in two Nebraska towns. The rope used to tie the boys was unique. Another clue turned up when one of the boy's brother was hypnotized and remembered a uniformed man in a tan car.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a day of fishing in a small, quiet village in Switzerland, a teenage boy did not return home as planned. The investigation revealed some important microscopic evidence in the water near where he was last seen. It was the only forensic evidence detectives had. But would it be enough for them to find him?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Detectives learn that a genetic disorder caused the deaths of a woman's children, resulting in an overturned conviction.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A patrol officer is shocked by the amount of blood at a traffic accident and is shocked by the coroner's ruling until an anonymous phone call re-ignites the case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police investigation of a pediatrician, after the mysterious death of one of her patients, leads them to a Texas hospital where the pediatric mortality rate was higher than at any hospital in the country. The common link was nurse Genene Jones, but proving the connection seems impossible until an international team of doctors uncovers an unlikely murder weapon.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Rachael Mullenix, 19, was convicted of stabbing her mother, Barbara Mullenix, on Sept. 13, 2006, and then packing her bloodied corpse in a cardboard box before dumping it in Newport Bay on the California coast.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1981, six-year-old Cassie Hansen disappeared from her St. Paul, Minnesota church during an evening service. After a tip from a witness that an older man was seen carrying a small body, Cassie's body was found in a dumpster.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On Halloween night 2004, Adriane Insogna and Leslie Mazzara were brutally murdered in their Napa, California home.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1995, Lisa Manderach and her daughter Devon left their Pennsylvania home to go shopping, but didn't return home. Lisa's husband Jimmy called police in a panic to report their disappearance and directed them to a nearby shopping center.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1994, Paul Gruber's daughter suspected something was wrong when she received birthday cards addressed from Gruber, on which the handwriting wasn't Gruber's.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Michigan State University grad student disappeared and was presumed dead. With the help of a professor of geological sciences, police hoped to get the 'dirt' on her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On September 17, 1984, in a suburb of Tucson, Arizona, eight-year-old Vicki Hoskins left home on her pink bicycle to mail a letter for her mother. She never returned, but her slightly damaged bicycle was found nearby. Investigators turned to forensic science, in the hope it would tell them not only what happened to Vicki, but also who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: One year after her father's death, a teen's role in a high school production of "Hamlet" causes her to reveal the chilling truth behind her family's tragedy.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 3-year-old son of parents in Dripping Springs, Texas develops a respiratory condition. Then the father develops signs of Alzheimer's disease, and an investigator reveals that their ill health is due to a form of black mold in their modern home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1962, the people of the small town of Hanford, California lost their sense of peace when one of their own, 15-year-old Marlene Miller, was murdered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a prosecutor discovers evidence linking a habitual drunk driver to a hit-and-run in which a child is killed, he combines the talents of an accident reconstruction expert with a video specialist. This case was the first in which video in the courtroom withstood an appeal, and helped make 'video testimony' viable in other cases.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Rosemary Anderson is found dead on the side of the road, her boyfriend becomes the prime suspect. He eventually confessed to her murder, but so did another man _ serial killer, Eric Edgar Cooke.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In this classic episode of Forensic Files, the longest running true crime series in television history, a serial bomber was waging a vendetta against the legal profession: A judge, two attorneys and even a courthouse had been targeted. programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1967, Lori Keidel, her two sisters and her brother were left home alone while their father went to a nearby laundromat. In 1993, Lori found the courage to tell police the vision that had possessed her for 29 years: that Lori had witnessed her mother's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A six-year-old girl ran and hid when she saw her grandmother being beaten to death, but the man followed, beat and assaulted her. She said the assailant was her uncle, who was convicted. She recanted her testimony years later.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When police officer Crystal Parker is found shot to death in her bed, the entire town of East Point, Georgia is stunned. programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: When a beloved local reporter is gunned down in Oakland, California, his death reverberates throughout the city and his reporting on the activities of a local empowerment group are called into question.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: Riverside, California is home to thousands of marines, sailors, and their families, but a grisly double-murder of a marine and his wife is the last thing local residents expect to confront.

programme.title: Celebrity Crime Files
programme.desc: Blasting on the scene in October of 1966 in Oakland, California, the Black Panther Party were a subversive civil rights group who became international sensations with a �freedom by any means necessary philosophy.� Along the way they empowered a generation but they also raised a lot of hell, tangled with police forces across the nation and were eventually public enemy number of the FBI�s infamous COINTELPRO program, which essentially targeted and wiped out numerous African American organizations. CCF looks at the life and crimes of its founders Huey P. Newton and Bobby Seale and its shining princess, the great Angela Davis.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: After a deady night-time home invasion, the family suspects a vindictive ex-lover, but the case grows cold after the suspect disappears; thirty years later, a family member hungry for justice helps police track down the vengeful killer.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: A Civil Rights landmark and the birthplace of rock ‘n roll, Memphis, Tennessee is the quintessential American South. When a beloved local NBA star is found shot to death in the woods, the city bands together to avenge their fallen hero.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: New Orleans a city drenched in history, culture, and the arts. However, it is also shrouded in a dark history of crime. When police find a beloved local gospel singer shot dead in the street, their investigation leads to more questions than answers.

programme.title: Celebrity Crime Files
programme.desc: There is a long list of people who died on the frontlines fighting for social justice for African-Americans. But there are three iconic men whose names remain legendary. Malcolm. Martin. Medgar. Just their first name is enough to make a nation remember the volatile 1960�s when these three bright stars and champions of civil rights were cut down in their prime. Their efforts, and those of the people who supported them and continued their work, have resulted in significant, groundbreaking changes. CCF explores the life and crimes of three titans.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: A church reverend follows the sound of gunshots and finds a young woman fighting for her life. Witnesses tell investigators the victim had been involved in a dramatic parking lot brawl earlier that day, had one of the women come back for payback?

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: When a pregnant Florida teen vanishes without a trace, her family immediately suspects the baby�s father who wanted revenge after she refused an abortion. But with the clock ticking and little evidence, will they be able to find justice?

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: After love blooms slowly, Katie Roberts knows that she’s found the one. With a loving partner and happy family life, Katie’s life seems to be pure bliss.
