programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: Jennifer Brundage finds the love of her life and when distance threatens to keep them apart, she goes to great lengths to keep him. Chade Harris has always played by the rules, until she meets a man that takes her on an unlawful ride.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we visit South Carolina. Philippe joins the Department of Natural Resources to tag tiger sharks in Port Royal Sound. Then we head inland for a hike to find wild venus fly traps. From there it's back to the shoreline of Port Royal Sound to examine ecosystem indicators through three different species of crab. Finally Congaree National Park is home to the largest hardwood forest in the US.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we head to the beautiful landscape of Glacier National Park. Philippe heads out to uncover insect fossils dating back 45 million years. Then we look at the intricate geology of the park itself. From there we track one of the most important food sources of the park - wild huckleberries. And then we join a group of students participating in a citizen science expedition.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at new ways of cultivating fresh, nutritious food. He visits a farm in Los Angeles where they grow food on a parking lot, just to show that fresh food can be grown in an urban environment. We also look into what distinguishes fruits from vegetables. The results can be surprising. And then we look at the amount of food that is wasted world wide.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we see how science helps us prepare for natural disasters. Philippe heads to the University of Miami to see their incredible SUSTAIN lab that can simulate a category 5 hurricane. Then it's off to the mountains of Alberta to learn about avalanche safety. From there's we head to South Carolina to follow researchers that study floods.

programme.desc: From social media to AI, advertising has changed dramatically in a short time. Host Raja Rajamannar sits down with marketing leaders to learn how they cut through the noise to reach consumers.

programme.title: Quantum Marketing:Liquid Death
programme.desc: From social media to AI, advertising has changed dramatically in a short time. Host Raja Rajamannar sits down with marketing leaders to learn how they cut through the noise to reach consumers.

programme.title: Quantum Marketing:Neuro-Insight
programme.desc: From social media to AI, advertising has changed dramatically in a short time. Host Raja Rajamannar sits down with marketing leaders to learn how they cut through the noise to reach consumers.

programme.title: Hello World:Nigeria: Where the Tech Hustle is Real
programme.desc: Hello World is an award-winning tech travel docuseries where Bloomberg Businessweek writer and NYT best-selling author Ashlee Vance as he travels the world to engage with the most brilliant, audacious and controversial pioneers of science and technology. Through his unmatched access, Vance demystifies their advancements so viewers come to understand the reasoning and ultimate application of these innovative concepts.

programme.title: Hello World:The Airship Strikes Back
programme.desc: Hello World is an award-winning tech travel docuseries where Bloomberg Businessweek writer and NYT best-selling author Ashlee Vance as he travels the world to engage with the most brilliant, audacious and controversial pioneers of science and technology. Through his unmatched access, Vance demystifies their advancements so viewers come to understand the reasoning and ultimate application of these innovative concepts.

programme.title: The Growing Toll of America's Booming Kratom Industry
programme.desc: American use of the Southeast Asian plant kratom has grown dramatically in recent years, spurring both a lucrative industry and national lobbying effort while worrying health experts who fear its addictive effects and point to thousands of related deaths. In this Bloomberg Originals documentary, we reveal how the unregulated substance is being promoted and even made more potent, and how some users are ending up dead.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: From wacky gifts to seriously developed skills, talent is everywhere. This episode showcases the talents of people across the nation, young and old, and how they use these gifts for good.

programme.title: Hockey Night in New England
programme.desc: Meet the Boston Junior Rangers, one of the most elite teams in the Eastern Hockey League. With a reputation for producing top NHL prospects, these new recruits must prove they can live up to the Junior Rangers standard.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Thrilling racing action, a treetop dinner, ice cream heaven and a caving adventure.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin, Ryan and Tony introduce us to a real-life superhero who has opened her home and heart to special needs children.

programme.title: The Middle Child
programme.desc: In the 1980s, a serial killer buried a woman and three girls in the woods of New Hampshire. One of those girls is still unidentified. WMUR joins the investigators who promise they won’t give up until her name is restored.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Join Greg and Maryam Durani as they explore Milwaukee from the eyes of their newest neighbors. Greg volunteers with kids at the library, hears powerful stories, and bakes specialty bread from Maryam's homeland. Don't miss this inspiring episode!

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: Creating public works on a great white canvas.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a coffeeshop chain to snowy railroad tracks, these unconventional crime scenes bring the childhood game of Cops & Robbers to life.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Chefs Sean Guy and Amy Hessel compete in this seafood showdown, the ultimate Battle of the Bay. Who will walk away with the title Captain of the Chesapeake?

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Aphrodisiacs, costumes, neon things and more on two cheap dates in New Orleans.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: There are no bounds to what women can achieve. In this episode, we highlight women from across the country who are fearless go-getters, helpers and even life-savers.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Kinga is in Manchester, NH, to meet Matt Krajcik, a 26-year-old curriculum developer who survived a trying childhood. Now he is looking to reconnect to the nature around him that provided respite when he was young.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Kate explores gin and rituals with a master distiller, talks art and cocktails with an Indigenous painter, and gets a lesson in moving mixology on George R.R. Martin’s adventure train in the high-desert city of Santa Fe.

programme.title: WMUR CloseUp
programme.desc: On CloseUp, political analyst Scott Spradling said former President Donald Trump showed he was a "changed man" during his speech at the Republic National Convention.

programme.title: Hour Long Docs List
programme.desc: A playlist of hour long VL Originals

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: Finding hygge while glamping in The White Mountains.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact travels to Ashburn, Virginia to see how residents are reacting to an increase in data centers. Plus, a state superintendent explains how dismantling the Department of Education could impact public schools. And, a New York grassroots program gives kids access to bike racing.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: Where half-used arts and crafts supplies are sparking creativity.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day learn that in Homestead, looks can be deceiving. The guys throw axes in a bank, zip line in a church, and end the day with a beer at Duke's.

programme.title: Finding Adventure

programme.desc: Orlando expert, Brendan O'Connor, celebrates the people behind the scenes of the businesses that make Orlando a truly unique place. Join him as he rolls up his sleeves and receives hands on training while spending a day with them, On The Job.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Power of One
programme.desc: News 8 is following the journey of a young York County woman with a stage 4 terminal cancer diagnosis as part of our series, "Power of One".

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: There are no bounds to what women can achieve. In this episode, we highlight women from across the country who are fearless go-getters, helpers and even life-savers.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A Missouri community seeks answers when two young women disappear a decade apart
